TopicTitle: sun corona/flare/light texture removal - one more thing to remove

Articles.Content:
Anybody know of a way to get rid of all the textures that show up over the sun? I'd love to be able to point the camera at it from the surface, zoom in with Camera Tools and see planets/moons transiting. Right now tho that all gets drawn over by the textures

**UPDATE**

So thx to removing the asset files I can lose the glare and flare the blocks any planets/moons that are in the immediate area of the sun. However there's still the bright texture that blots out the central part of the sun I'd like to see removed as well, as it removes features of the sun like sunspots from direct view. I saw in KittopiaSpace folder from KittopiaTech a glow.png texture that I modified to be fully transparent but that didn't have an effect

I think that it was Shared asset 10, but deleting the entire file would be a big mistake, because the last time I checked, it had a lot of files inside of it.

The only way that I can think of is to use a Unity asset decompiler and then replace the old sunflare with a blank image file, then recompile it. More information could be found in the old Universe Replacer thread If you feel up to it. (someone in that thread posted an alternate sunflare texture and included a decompiler).

Unfortunately that's the best I can do off of memory, good luck with the edit!

It's in sharedassets9. Do **NOT** delete the sharedassets files since it will bug out the game a lot.

The better solution would be to get Unity Asset Explorer and just remove the sunflare.tex and 01\_sun.tex. By removing the whole file, you're also losing Eve.mat, Jool.mat, Kerbin.mat, LoadingBackground.mat, 04\_jool.tex, 02\_eve.tex, LoadingBackground.tex, 03\_Kerbin.tex, and about 10 other assets that the game uses.

So I'd imagine there are several spots in your game (though you may not have noticed them yet) that are missing backgrounds and textures. There's also some AUDIO in that .assets file that you are losing.
